Package org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.push

Class AbstractPushModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.identity.authentication.spi.AMLoginModule
      • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.push.AbstractPushModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginModule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticatorPush, AuthenticatorPushRegistration
    public abstract class AbstractPushModule
extends AMLoginModule
    An abstract push module holding the necessary json serialization classes to communicate with the core token service.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected CTSPersistentStore coreTokenService
      Used to store tokens which may be updated by other machines in the cluster.
      protected String nearInstantProperty
      Used to make the polling occur every second.
      protected PushNotificationService pushService
      Used to communicate messages out from OpenAM through a configurable Push delegate.
      protected SessionCookies sessionCookies
      Used to understand what loadbalancer cookie we should inform the remote device of.
      protected UserPushDeviceProfileManager userPushDeviceProfileManager
      Necessary to read data from the appropriate user's attribute.

        amCache, auditor, currentState

    • Field Detail

      • nearInstantProperty

        protected final String nearInstantProperty
        Used to make the polling occur every second. Not recommended to be set in production.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • coreTokenService

        protected final CTSPersistentStore coreTokenService
        Used to store tokens which may be updated by other machines in the cluster.

        Necessary to read data from the appropriate user's attribute.

        Used to communicate messages out from OpenAM through a configurable Push delegate.

        Used to understand what loadbalancer cookie we should inform the remote device of.

    • Method Detail

      • storeInCTS

        protected void storeInCTS​(String messageId,
                          Set<Predicate> servicePredicates,
                          long timeout)
                   throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException,
                          CoreTokenException
        Stores the message information in the CTS, to be used across the cluster.
        Parameters:
        messageId - The ID of this message.
        servicePredicates - Predicates associated with this message.
        timeout - The timeout on this message in miliseconds.
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If the predicates could not be serialized.
        CoreTokenException - If the CTS could not be written to.

      • getDevice

        protected PushDeviceSettings getDevice​(String username,
                                       String realm)
                                throws AuthLoginException
        Retrieves a Push Device for a user in a realm.
        Parameters:
        username - Name of the user whose device to retrieve.
        realm - Realm in which the user is operating.
        Returns:
        The user's PushDeviceSettings, or null if none exist.
        Throws:
        AuthLoginException - If we were unable to read the user's profile.

      • checkCTSAuth

        protected Boolean checkCTSAuth​(String tokenId)
                        throws CoreTokenException
        Checks the CTS for the existence of a token with the expected name, and ensures that the deny field is not populated with 'true'.
        Parameters:
        tokenId - The token's Id.
        Returns:
        true if the CTS has the message and it's not denied, false if the CTS has the message and it is denied, null if the CTS has no message.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - if there were issues reading from the CTS.

      • checkCTSRegistration

        protected org.forgerock.json.JsonValue checkCTSRegistration​(String tokenId)
                                                     throws CoreTokenException
        Checks the CTS for the existence of a token with the expected name, and ensures that the necessary fields are correctly populated.
        Parameters:
        tokenId - The token's Id.
        Returns:
        jsonValue containing the necessary data for registration as defined at the top of AuthenticatorPushRegistration.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - if there were issues reading from the CTS.
